headline: Old-Fashioned Potato Salad
description: This classic potato salad recipe makes a creamy potato salad with hard-boiled eggs, celery, and relish. Perfect for summer BBQs, picnics, or potlucks.

video.description: The potato salad in this video is served the old-fashioned way, with eggs, celery and relish. And the recipe is surprisingly good served with chili!
video.name: How to Make Old Fashioned Potato Salad

name: Old-Fashioned Potato Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes.
Drain, cool, peel, and chop potatoes.
While potatoes cook, place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring water to a boil; cover, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes.
Remove from hot water, cool, peel, and chop eggs.
Combine the potatoes, eggs, celery, onion, relish, mayonnaise, mustard, garlic salt, celery salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Mix together well and refrigerate until chilled.

review.reviewBody: On my second attempt at potato salad using this recipe I nailed it. I followed the instructions to the letter, properly timed the potatoes, and used the Allrecipes instructions for perfect hard-boiled eggs. The family loved it and I will make it again and again. One tip for newcomers: read the comments. There is some very valuable advice in them
My favorite potato salad recipe! Everyone I’ve made it for love it. Thank you for sharing.
i didn hava celery or relish but it i made it and it was amazing!!

It was a little bland for our taste do I altered it a bit. Instead of relish I substituted mayo with Miracle Whip for more zest. I also top mine with sliced boiled eggs, strictly for appearance but people seem to gravitate to them. Sprinkle with paprika.
Delicious Love that I didn't have to buy another of spices that I would only use one time

The first time I Made this just as it is and was really good, a nice comfort food recipe that takes you back to grandmas. The second time I made it I added red and yellow peppers used white pepper, and when ready to serve used smoked paprika as a garnish. 3rd time the same thing and added shredded Colby cheese to it. All about personal taste for additions. This recipe as written is a 5 star as far as a good comfort home cooked recipe.

This is incredible potato salad!!! I’m feeding a lot of people so I doubled up..did 5lbs of red potatoes included the peelings in the mix, and used yellow onion and green onions. Doubled all the ingredients. By accident I got the Walmart brand sweet relish and that was surprisingly incredible tasting! Perfect amount of sweetness for this potato salad. Love this recipe ❤️ We eat a lot of different potato salads and this is by far the winner

This is so good! I used about two pounds of red potatoes, cut in quarters, and boiled the recommended 15 minutes. Added the eggs to the boiling potatoes, removed after 12 minutes, and chilled in ice water. Pulled the skins off the cooled potatoes, returned them to the cooking kettle, and chopped with the eggs, celery, red onion, and 1/2 cup red pepper. Made the dressing in a separate bowl, increasing the mayonnaise to 3/4 cup, used a heaping 1/2 cup sweet pickle relish and a heaping tablespoon Dijon ground mustard. The rest of the seasonings as per recipe. Taste tested b4 adding to the potato mixture. If too dry, add more mayonnaise. Easy to make and cleanup. Is my new favorite potato salad.

My mom added diced dill pickles in her potato salad. I continue the tradition and every likes my pototo Salad. A lot of them have started adding the pickles My mom also put diced dill pickles in her meatloaf and again I do the same. Every one says the same thing “Ive never heard os seen pickles in meatloaf but they always ask for and me how good it is I know this won’t please everyone. But try it. You might enjoy it.

I changed the recipe because I didn't have celery or relish. I added dill and smoked paprika and a dollop of sour cream, maybe a little more mayonnaise. I also used dijon mustard. It came out perfectly, I'll add celery next time.
Delicious I added a pinch of dill weed. And used miracle whip. Excellant

Love this recipe. Very little mayo (surprised). First time, I substituted 1 teaspoon of celery seeds for the 1 cup celery (didn't have celery) and used the butter gold potatoes. 2nd time I made with red potatoes and added the celery. Our preference is definitely with butter gold potatoes (peeled) and celery seed. So delicious and creamy!
Excellent recipe that actually teaches you about properties of ingredients so you understand the principles that create the flavors, and know how to modify it for your taste preferences.
Perfect every time! :)
I add bacon to mine. Otherwise this is a great basic recipe.
A splash of olive oil and a few dashes of Maggi. Closest recipe to my moms. Very good, I definitely will use again. Oh,and I used yellow potatoes, I like their smooth texture.

As another reviewer mentioned, I added an extra 1/4 cup of mayo and used a scant 1/4 cup of celery seed because that's what I had on hand. Sadly, my potatoes weren't quite done after 15 minutes ( I did test them and should've known better). On the bright side, they're certainly not mushy!

Good but I also adjusted the ingredients to my liking I like more mustard and mayo and I could do with less relish to none nobody says it Has to be down to the “T” on making something everyone’s taste buds are different.
My family enjoyed this potato salad very much. However, it was missng something. I added a small amount of dry dill and, a splash of apple cider vinegar.

I chose this recipe because it is the closest one I could find that matched my mother's recipe. 🥔🥔There were only a few differences.🥚🥚I chose not to use the fresh chopped celery, simply because of my dental work. 🌰I did add the celery salt. 🧂A must in potato salad. 🥔I used finely chopped jerkin sweet pickles, 🥒instead of the relish. Delicious!😊💜
I used hot & sweet snacked pickles chopped up instead of sweet pickle relish. Quick, easy and really tasty salad! Great recipe!

I am very picky about potato salad and am usually very disappointed in them. This, by far, is the BEST recipe I have come across!!! The changes I made were minute. I left out the celery (because I'm not a fan) and used finely chopped sweet pickles. I used garlic powder not garlic salt and I used celery seeds instead of celery salt (both because they were what I had on hand). I added a a pinch of kosher salt to make up for it. It hasn't been "marinating" very long and it's delicious. I can't wait until tomorrow's portion! This is definitely bookmarked, printed and the link send to my own email. THANK YOU!!!
This is the recipe I have always made as I got it from my Mother. I was born in 1944 and this is the only recipe I remember her making.

This recipe, at least the day I read it, 5/25/22, calls for 1/4 cup mayonnaise. That is not nearly enough. I raised it to 1.5 cups, and could have used more but that was about right. Also used 2 tbls mustard. The video does not show the same ingredients/proportions as the recipe.

I've been making this potato salad for years and it's delicious. The only difference, I use dill pickle relish or cut-up dill pickles as I prefer the tart taste over sweet. Although, don't knock it till you try it, so maybe my next potato salad will have sweet relish. Maybe I'll change.

Potato salad like my family makes, only we use dill not sweet pickles. And chopped pickles not relish. The amount of mayo & mustard is a guideline to start with. Adjust to your taste. The mounds of potatoes I peeled and chopped as a kid for family gatherings!
This was the exact recipe I was looking for. It is the way my mother made potato salad. I will probably add celery seed to it, but that's about it.
Delicious and very easy to make it
It came out creamy and scrumdiddlyumptious. My fam enjoyed it. I put paprika on top. I made it the day before. The flavor was outstanding.
It is absolutely perfect, I like heat so I added a jalapeno pepper . The flavors all blend nicely
Really good potato salad! I didn't measure the onion & celery very carefully, and I used dill pickle relish instead of sweet relish. This will be my go-to potato salad recipe.
Looks and smells really good.
My family love this recipe. I did add a full cup of mayo because we liked it a bit creamer .
This is the best Potato Salad! I will never try any other Potato Salad recipes. I followed the recipe, but I did not add pickle relish, we don’t like pickle relish in potato or macaroni salad.
A good classic Potato Salad!

I'm picky about my potato salad. Most of the stuff you buy in grocery stores is to sweet and the taters are to crunchy too not done enough. I used 4 baking taters that were sitting in the vegie bin and needed to be used. The salad came out great. I added 2 more eggs and more celery and onions since the taters were so big. A skoosh more mayo and sweet relish. I would do a little more mustard than a tbsp. next batch. Otherwise this was wonderful!
Very tasty! I used unpeeled red potatoes!
A nice variation from the original! I substituted greek yogurt for the mayonnaise!
I had to add mayo to provide more moisture. Otherwise awesome reminder recipe. Reminded me of picnics as a kid.
this was fantastic. but did some tweaks: used red onion, but not as much. onion salt instead of celery salt, and added some dried dill

Ok, who stole my Mom's famous potato salad recipe that she never wrote down? Just kidding, but the biggest compliment: this is undoubtedly the BEST and CLOSEST recipe to my mother's amazing potato salad, and I will be using it again and again, and passing it along to friends and family. My 85 year old neighbor from Norway even told me it was the best potato salad she has ever had! Thank you!
Love it! Easy to make, though a bit time consuming. My husband is a potato salad connoisseur, and he can't get enough of this.
Very good. I added a half cup low fat plain yogurt to make it creamier and used finely chopped sweet pickles in place of relish and used a sweet onion.
It had all of the ingredients that I remember from my childhood when my mother made it. It was delicious. I did add shredded carrots, because my Mother used them.
Tasted good. I chopped a pickle into tiny pieces for relish.
This Potato Salad was delicious!!! I did have to add a little more mayo since it was kind of dry - but love it!!!!
Just like my mom made and goes well with burgers, bbq chicken, etc
This was awesome! I made a couple of changes of adding the peprika and garlic seasoning to it! It gave it an amazing flavor, this recipe gives you an awesome base.
It's a good recipe. I will use it again.

My husband wanted a little more zing to my potato salad recipe and this looked like a good alternative. I am going to cut back on the relish, onion, and mustard the next time I make it for our taste and I'm sure it will be just right!
Just like potato salad out to be. I did double the mayo and mustard as it was a bit dry at first but otherwise didn't change a thing!
I’ve been making that potato salad for years, my mom taught me , when I was a teenager, I’m 58 now, lol

Used 1 lb of red potatoes and subbed green onions and cornichons. Used 2 eggs and halved the rest of the ingredients except the mayo - used 1/2 cup of mayo. It was delicious!! Would definitely make again.
It was good; I'll make it again.
Took this dish to a party. A few weeks later the hosts asked me to make it for her daughter's wedding. Couldn't ask for a better compliment. Definitely a keeper.
first try. Turned out pretty good with some adjustments on amounts/measurements
A family favorite. I substituted scallions for onion. Milder taste. Yum!!
Similar to what mom used to make ... though w/o her love as an ingredient, it'll never be quite as good!
I added a lot more mayo, as some suggested, as well as added a little more salt. It’s really good!
I love this recipe! I did not use relish & I substituted celery salt for parsley flakes.
It turned out great for our July 4th barbecue. Tangy and sweet.
Wonderful!! Easy and delicious! Reminded me of mom's! I did leave out the relish and added chopped carrots :)
This was easy and delicious. I did add fresh dill and half a red bell pepper because I had them. Everyone loved it and it’s not too heavy on the mayo.

This is the BEST! I've made it numerous times and it's just like your mama made it only better. I didn't change I a thing except I made the potatoes and eggs at one time in the Instant pot and I added some Celery salt. excellent recipe!!!
Great dish easy to make. This is perfect for cookouts.
I made it for 2 and it came out really good. I just added some Cheyenne because I luke a little of spice.
Very good side dish. As always, I make the dish following the recipe the first time. I can make changes the next time I prepare it when I know what might actually make it better.
It was delicious. I pretty much doubled it and left the onions out. It was a huge hit!! I also added dill.

This recipe is wonderfully reminiscent of my mom’s recipe for Sunday dinners or summer picnics. I downsized the recipe for 3 portions and followed the recipe except for my portion which was “veganized” (no eggs, substituted “Veganaise” for mayo . It was delicious!). Even on the three setting and minus 1 cup for me, the recipe could serve 4 hearty appetites.
I added a few chopped grape tomatoes..adds color & cool flavor on a hot day :)

It rated okay because I had to use twice the mayo and twice the sweet pickle relish. The 5 potato ingredient is a poor description, weight should be used. I used 4 russet potatoes and the amount of dressing was inadequate. While the video mentions cutting the potatoes, the recipe does not.
Best potato salad recipe ever!

This is pretty close to how I make my own potato salad, but I do not add mustard. Other than that, I do used boiled eggs, but I add more like 5 or 6 chopped and I also add more mayo. I never have any left-overs.
Thank you!!! Soooo yummy! I didn't have celery - no biggie - added bacon (not really an equal substitution haha, but was super good).
Great recipe! Classic start of summer dish, a must with hotdogs, hamburgers and baked beans! Don't forget the s'mores...and for all the adults a well chilled sangria! Welcome summer!

This tasted awesome! I didn't have much relish left, so I added some cucumber slices and a little apple cider vinegar and sugar, so it would help to make up for my shortage. Followed everything else to a T and it was awesome!!

This was good! I did add more mayo though. The 3rd day I remembered what my Mother in law did which was mixing half & half or in my case cream with mayo, mustard, apple cider vinegar, a little sugar and white pepper. That put the potato salad over the top!

This is my new go-to favorite potato salad. I've been doing the same thing for years and this one was a little different than my original recipe... mainly, this has more sweet relish than mine did. We love it! I use this exact recipe every time. Thanks!
Not bad...I enjoyed the flavor but WAY to much celery. I didn't even put the recommended amount in and it was a total crunch fest. I'm making a batch today without the celery.
I have never been a huge fan of potato salad but this one is Ridiculously Delicious!!!! Thanks for sharing!!
Very good!
Really good, first attempt. Will be making again soon
Was great, but used 1/2 cup Mayonnaise
Good
okay, this recipe was simply AMAZING... I cant cook for the life of me, but followed this recipe to a tee and it was a huge hit!! Thank you so much!
I just left out the relish, everyone loved it!
It was exactly the type of potato salad that I wanted and have trouble finding when out and about. Not complicated or over thought out. Good ol’ back in the day potato salad!

Changes:
Substituted dill pickles for relish, peeled skin then chopped
Used organic baby potatoes, boiled whole
Chopped cooked potatoes into quarters
Used YELLOW mustard
Substituted REAL Mayo for Miracle Whip
Added 1 tsp of white vinegar 
Added regular salt to taste
It’s always better the next day after it’s been in the refrigerator over night..........
I also used about 2/3 cup mayo

very good, but 1/4 C. mayo? I don't think so. I used almost that much with just 1 potato (i ate it hot, before cooling and it was still very good). I used celery seed, as I had no celery salt. Used 4 eggs also.
It was the same recipe that my Mom made, so it brought back many fond memories. I've made it many times and my friends always love it!

I always read the suggestions and go from there. I followed the basic recipe, but added a second spoon of mustard, and some pickle juice. My crew doesn't like 'sweet' flavored pickles so used hamburger dills since that is what I have on hand. I added two extra eggs since it's Easter and I have an abundance. I mixed in maybe 1/4 cup more mayo to account for my changes. I love it!
I made it for the first time ever. I had a chef tast it and he loved it said it was very good. He complemented my ability to follow a recipe.
Thank you so much for sharing this. It tastes just like my momma use to make.......luv
Easy and great tasting
Only thing I did different was add an extra potato and a full cup of mustard to give it that zing! Oh and of course sugar.

This recipe is very similar to one my grandmother used to make. I left out the celery salt because I didn't have any and did what others suggested and added a little little more mayo. I also didn't add a whole cup of celery. A little more than 1/2 cup and finely diced was all I needed. I used around 8 potatoes. Sliced a 4th egg on top as a garnish and topped with Paprika. It was very good
I liked the recipe, but I had to add additional seasonings.
Great basic recipe. Very tasty and my family of 4 ate all of - so I will be increasing the serving size to have enough for leftovers.

This recipe falls a tad short for my taste. I add 1/2 minced green bell pepper to the minced celery & red onion, & instead of relish, I mince 4 large sweet gherkins and add about 2 Tbs. of the pickle juice plus 1-1/2 tsp. white vinegar to the veggies, along with garlic powder, onion powder, seasoned salt & P. In addition to the mayo, I added about 2 Tbs. each whole milk yoghurt & yellow mustard. Blend veggies and dressing well before adding the potatoes (still warm) & chopped eggs. Slice two hard boiled eggs into rounds and place on top of the salad, sprinkle with smoked paprika & optionally place olive slices on center of yolks.
